verses.verse: Truly God<WH430> is good<WH2896> to Israel<WH3478>, even to such as are of a clean<WH1249> heart<WH3824>.
But as for me<WH7272>, my feet were almost<WH4592> gone<WH5186>; my steps<WH838> had well near<WH369> slipped<WH8210>.
For I was envious<WH7065> at the foolish<WH1984>, when I saw<WH7200> the prosperity<WH7965> of the wicked<WH7563>.
For there are no pains<WH2784> in their death<WH4194>: but their strength<WH193> is firm<WH1277>.
They are not in trouble<WH5999> as other men<WH582>; neither are they plagued<WH5060> like<WH5973> other men<WH120>.
Therefore pride<WH1346> encompasses them about as a chain<WH6059>; violence<WH2555> covers<WH5848> them as a garment<WH7897>.
Their eyes<WH5869> stand out<WH3318> with fatness<WH2459>: they have more<WH5674> than heart<WH3824> could wish<WH4906>.
They are corrupt<WH4167>, and speak<WH1696> wickedly<WH7451> concerning oppression<WH6233>: they speak<WH1696> loftily<WH4791>.
They set<WH8371> their mouth<WH6310> against the heavens<WH8064>, and their tongue<WH3956> walks<WH1980> through the earth<WH776>.
Therefore his people<WH5971> return<WH7725> here<WH1988>: and waters<WH4325> of a full<WH4392> cup are wrung out to them<WH4680>.
And they say<WH559>, How does God<WH410> know<WH3045>? and is there<WH3426> knowledge<WH1844> in the most High<WH5945>?
Behold<WH7563>, these are the ungodly, who prosper<WH7961> in the world<WH5769>; they increase<WH7685> in riches<WH2428>.
Truly I have cleansed<WH2135> my heart<WH3824> in vain<WH7385>, and washed<WH7364> my hands<WH3709> in innocence<WH5356>.
For all the day<WH3117> long have I been plagued<WH5060>, and chastened<WH8433> every morning<WH1242>.
If I say<WH559>, I will speak<WH5608> thus<WH3644>; behold<WH898>, I should offend against the generation<WH1755> of your sons<WH1121>.
When I thought<WH2803> to know<WH3045> this<WH5999>, it was too painful for me<WH5869>;
Until I went<WH935> into the sanctuary<WH4720> of God<WH410>; then understood<WH995> I their end<WH319>.
Surely you did set<WH7896> them in slippery places<WH2513>: you casted them down<WH5307> into destruction<WH4876>.
How are they brought into desolation<WH8047>, as in a moment<WH7281>! they are utterly<WH5486> consumed<WH8552> with terrors<WH1091>.
As a dream<WH2472> when one awakes<WH6974>; so<WH136>, O Lord, when you awake<WH5782>, you shall despise<WH959> their image<WH6754>.
Thus my heart<WH3824> was grieved<WH2556>, and I was pierced<WH8150> in my heart<WH3629>.
So foolish<WH1198> was I<WH3045>, and ignorant: I was as a animal before you<WH929>.
Nevertheless I am continually<WH8548> with you<WH270>: you have held me by my right<WH3225> hand<WH3027>.
You shall guide<WH5148> me with your counsel<WH6098>, and afterward<WH310> receive<WH3947> me to glory<WH3519>.
Whom have I in heaven<WH8064> but you<WH776>? and there is none upon earth that I desire beside you<WH2654>.
My flesh<WH7607> and my heart<WH3824> fails<WH3615>: but God<WH430> is the strength<WH6697> of my heart<WH3824>, and my portion<WH2506> for ever<WH5769>.
For<WH7369>, behold, they that are far from you shall perish<WH6>: you have destroyed<WH6789> all them that go a whoring from you<WH2181>.
But<WH589> it is good<WH2896> for me to draw near<WH7132> to God<WH430>: I have put<WH7896> my trust<WH4268> in the Lord<WH136> God<WH3069>, that I may declare<WH5608> all your works<WH4399>.
